result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin X Hernandez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Revoked - Sentenced to Co Jail/HOC, effective November 1, 2016

1:23 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Joey Roeth.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Roeth has received a copy of the revocation packet, with no corrections, additions or deletions.  State has received a copy of the revocation packet, with no corrections, additions or deletions.  ADA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by ADA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Roeth.  No statement by defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

Counts 1 

9 months county jail, with huber and consecutive to any other sentence.  Court grants out of county travel and out of county service.

Count 2

9 months county jail, concurrent to count 1, but consecutive to any other sentence.  Court grants huber and out of county service and out of county travel.

Sentence is to commence immediately.  Court grants the defendant 84 days of sentence credit.

Court orders the court costs of $460.07 on count 1 and restitution of $70.70 joint & several, be reduced to a civil judgments and $443.00 on count 2 be reduced to a civil judgment.

Statement by Atty Roeth - believes the restitution has been paid in full.  Statement by the Court in regards to proof of payment.

Court adjourned at 1:29 p.m.
By Atty Joey Roeth
Sentencing hearing on revocation on November 1, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Petition and Stipulation to Waive Appearance and Order Extending Probation for Unpaid Court Obligations - 1 year, New Discharge Date October 7, 2017

1:08 pm
 Defendant Justin X Hernandez in custody in court without counsel.  Agent Deb Duel in court.
Defendant made payment in the amount of $75 today per Agent.
Court finds the Defendant has not made a good faith effort and extends probation for 1 year.
Court informs the Defendant that, if not paid, the Court will fashion conditions to include jail time.
Court instructs the Defendant regarding right to and how to obtain counsel.
Court adjourned at 1:14 pm
Probation review hearing on September 12, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

43

2:12 p.m.  State by ADA Lisa Vanden Branden.  Defendant present with Attorney Barb Privat.

ADA recites agreement - moves to amend count 1 to PTAC - Criminal Trespass to Dwelling in violation of  943.14 (M-A) and plea to count 2.  Requests restitution in the amount of $70.70 - joint and several.  Attorney Privat concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - waived.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs regarding the maximum penalties on each count.  Court instructs regarding deportation.  

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST to the indicated charges.  Court finds the pleas have been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently, and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support each plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on both counts as indicated - both PTAC and orders a judgment of convictions be entered today.  ADA confirms compliance with any victim/witness rights.  Sentencing argument by ADA.  Sentencing argument by Attorney Privat.  No statement by the defendant.

Count 1
Court orders SWD and places the defendant on probation for 2 years.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
Serve 10 days ccounty jail with huber - commence within 60 days.
NO contact with the victim.  Court instructs regarding forms of no contact.
NO contact with the co-defendant (Logan Steinbach).  
Pay restitution of $70.70 - joint and several with the co-defendant.
Abide with all other rules/recommendations as imposed by the supervising agent.
Pay court costs

Count 2
Court orders SWD and places the defendant on probation for 2 years.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
Perform 25 hours of community service.
Abide with all other rules/recommendations as imposed by the supervising agent.
Pay court costs.

Court has no objection to applying for early termination of probation after one year - abide with all rules, pay all monetary, and with affirmative recommendation from supervising agent.

Courot adjourned at 2:24 p.m.



Court adjourned at 2:

Court directs Plea/Sentencing to be held in approximately sixty days.

Attorney Mitchell indicates the defendant requests to waive the preliminary hearing.  Defendant concurs.  Court instructs defendant of his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives this right.  Court accepts the waiver and binds the defendant over for trial.  

ADA files an Information with the court and provides a copy to Attorney Mitchell.  Attorney Mitchell confirms receipt of the Information - waives reading - enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  Court makes statement regarding the maximum penalties.

Court directs case be set for Status Hearing in approximately thirty days.

3:03 p.m.  State by ADA Lisa Vanden Branden.  Defendant present in custody and via video from Green Lake County Jail, with Attorney Reisha Mitchell.

Attorney Mitchell confirms receipt of the complaint - waives reading - requests preliminary hearing.  Court instructs regarding the maximum penalties.  Court finds probable cause.

Court orders bond set at $2,000 signature bond with the conditions of:  NO contact with William B. (victim) or the co-defendant (Logan Steinbach).    Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.

Attorney Mitchell waives the time limits on the preliminary hearing.  Court directs matter be set for Status Hearing, regarding counsel, and to be held in approximately two weeks.
